study.title: Aerobic bacteria in post surgical wound infections and pattern of their antimicrobial susceptibility in Ayder Teaching and Referral Hospital, Mekelle, Ethiopia

design.inclusion_criteria_text: Patients who had undergone surgery in general surgery and orthopaedic wards, and showed symptoms of infection clinically within 30 days of post surgical procedure.
design.exclusion_criteria_text: Surgical patients with community-acquired pyogenic infections such as abscess, furuncle and carbuncles; patients with infection of an episiotomy; and patients with open fractures.

country_specific_sites: Ayder Teaching and Referral Hospital, Mekelle

eligibility.population: Patients who had undergone surgery in general surgery and orthopaedic wards, and showed symptoms of infection clinically within 30 days of post surgical procedure.
eligibility.intervention: Pre-surgical antibiotic prophylaxis (Ceftriazone, Cloxacilline, or both)

populations.description: All patients with post-surgical wound infection enrolled in Ayder Teaching and Referral Hospital, Mekelle, Ethiopia, January-June 2012.

provenance.text_snippet: A total of 128 patients (98 male and 30 female) with clinical signs of post surgical wound infections were enrolled.

definitions.resistance_definition_text: Standard disc diffusion technique for drug susceptibility test (DST) as recommended by Clinical and Laboratory Standard Institute (CLSI).
definitions.outcome_definitions_text: Postoperative wound infection: infection in the tissues of the incision and operative area that commonly occurs between the fifth and 30th days after surgery.

provenance.text_snippet: Standard bacteriological methods were used for bacterial isolation and antimicrobial susceptibility pattern.

lab_methods.specimen_collection_method: Two wound swabs collected using sterile cotton swabs from each patient, cleaned with normal saline and sterile gauze.
lab_methods.culture_method: First swab for Gram stain; second swab inoculated into blood agar, MacConkey agar, and mannitol-salt agar, incubated at 37°C for 24–48 hours.
lab_methods.QC_measures: Reference strains P.aeruginosa (ATCC-27853), E.coli (ATCC-25922), S.aureus (ATCC-25923) used for identification and drug susceptibility testing.
lab_methods.organism_identification_method: Gram stain, hemolytic activity, catalase reaction, coagulase test for Gram-positive; colony morphology, oxidase, TSI, SIM, citrate, urease for Gram-negative.

provenance.text_snippet: Standard disc diffusion technique for drug susceptibility test (DST) was performed as recommended by Clinical and Laboratory Standard Institute (CLSI) [15].

ssi_incidence.notes: SSI defined as infection within 30 days post-surgery; only aerobic bacteria cultured.

provenance.text_snippet: Bacterial growth was seen in 96/128(75%) of the patients yielding a total of 123 bacterial isolates.

amr_proportions.notes: 100% susceptible to vancomycin; 90% resistant to tetracycline, ceftriazone, ampicillin.
All S. aureus isolates were sensitive to vancomycin.
All P. aeruginosa isolates were sensitive to gentamicin.
All CoNS isolates were sensitive to vancomycin.
83.1% of Gram negative isolates were sensitive to gentamicin.

provenance.text_snippet: 54/ 65 (83.1%) of Gram negative ... sensitive to Gentamicin

amr_proportions.notes: 100% of Gram positive isolates were sensitive to vancomycin.

provenance.text_snippet: 58/58 (100%) of Gram positive isolates were sensitive to Gentamicin and Vancomycin, respectively.

risk_factors_effects.exposure: Longer duration from admission to discharge (>14 days)
risk_factors_effects.notes: Multivariate logistic regression analysis for factors associated with bacterial isolation from post operative patients.

provenance.text_snippet: Duration from operation to discharge >14 days 4.92 (3.62-6.96) p=0.008

risk_factors_effects.notes: Wound class III associated with higher odds of bacterial isolation.
Wound class IV associated with higher odds of bacterial isolation.
Orthopaedic ward associated with higher odds of bacterial isolation.
Emergency operation associated with higher odds of bacterial isolation.

interventions.description: Pre-surgical antibiotic prophylaxis with Cloxacilline, Ceftriazone, or both.

provenance.text_snippet: Sixty (46.87%), 36(28.12%) and 31(24.2%) of the patients were given Ceftriazone, Cloxacilline and combination of both, respectively for pre-surgical prophylaxis.

codes.summary: High prevalence of post-surgical wound infection (75%) observed in Ayder Teaching and Referral Hospital.

evidence_quotes.quote: Prevalence of was Post-operative wound infections rate in this current study was 75%

codes.location_context: Ethiopia, Ayder Teaching and Referral Hospital

codes.subtheme: resistance patterns and rates by pathogen/antibiotic
codes.summary: High rates of multidrug resistance (82.92%) among isolates, with most Gram-negative and Gram-positive bacteria sensitive only to gentamicin and vancomycin, respectively.

evidence_quotes.quote: multi drug resistance was seen in 102/123(82.92%) of the isolates leaving clinicians with few choices of drugs for the treatment of post surgical wound infected patients.

codes.location_context: Ethiopia, Ayder Teaching and Referral Hospital

codes.summary: Indiscriminate use and easy availability of antibiotics may contribute to high resistance rates.

evidence_quotes.quote: This remarkably higher resistance may be due to their easily availability and indiscriminate use of the drugs without proper prescription.

codes.location_context: Ethiopia, Ayder Teaching and Referral Hospital

codes.summary: Periodic surveillance of bacteria and antibiotic susceptibility is recommended to prevent further emergence and spread of resistant pathogens.

evidence_quotes.quote: Therefore, periodic surveillance of bacteria and antibiotic susceptibility is important to prevent further emergence and spread of resistant bacteria pathogens.

codes.location_context: Ethiopia, Ayder Teaching and Referral Hospital

codes.summary: Lack of data on anaerobic bacteria and fungi in post-surgical wound infections is a limitation.

evidence_quotes.quote: The study did not isolate strict anaerobes bacteria and fungi, which could have increased the number of bacterial isolates reported as negative cultures.

codes.location_context: Ethiopia, Ayder Teaching and Referral Hospital

funding_sources: Mekelle University College of Health Sciences grant
funding_conflicts.conflicts_of_interest: The authors declare that they have no competing interests.

provenance.text_snippet: Mekelle University College of Health Sciences for giving grant to conduct the research.

notes_flags.detail: No data on mortality, reoperations, readmissions, length of stay, costs, or stewardship guidelines.
No explicit mention of bed capacity or surgical volume per year.
No comorbidity data (e.g., HIV, diabetes) reported.
No information on infection control or stewardship program presence.
